comments:
BUILD:  20011219

I haven't quite been able to reproduce this, but it happened when trying to set 
a breakpoint when I had some old, disabled breakpoints that may have been 
invalid (e.g. code was different, possibly missing).  Unfortunately, I was in a 
hurry, so I just removed all the breakpoints and the problem went away.  One 
thing that didn't work was restarting Eclipse, so something was persisted 
somewhere.

Sorry I can't give more details, if time permits, I will try to add more 
information if I can reproduce the problem.

I believe that this is a duplicate of bug 7425.
Could your resources associated with the old breakpoints been renamed/moved?

Could be the same root problem (I didn't see this as the default search doesn't 
pick up closed bugs).  I didn't take the time to examine the offending 
breakpoints, but it's possible that at least one of them was on something that 
was moved or renamed.  

Of course, my stack trace is a little different, and I was in the regular 
editor, not the debug perspective breakpoints view.  I will try to verify by 
moving a CU with a breakpoint, closing eclipse, and restarting. 

-Andrew

I put a breakpoint in a CU, moved it, closed eclipse, restarted eclipse, and 
tried to place a new breakpoint in an unrelated CU in the editor.  No error.  
Do you have specific instructions on how to reproduce bug 7425?

-Andrew
Closing. No longer appears to be a problem.
